intro: Chassalia simplex, commonly known as the slender chassalia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, featuring slender stems and narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, arranged in dense clusters at the top of the plant. Chassalia simplex is often found in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils.
